reviewText: This was intended as a review copy for someone else.  I don't know what she thought of it but I really enjoyed the movie One Special Night.  The other two were hardly worth watching.  You may like all or none.
Title: Holiday Triple Feature One Special Night / Christmas Clause / Christmas in the Clouds

reviewText: I had 'One Special Night' which I had gotten on TV, but there were some less than perfect spots in it.  It did not come through as clearly as I would have liked, but it was "free".  This year when I saw the disc I ordered it cost less than a disc with ONLY the movie I wanted and it was accompanied by 2 more Christmas movies.  Three for less than one!  How could I resist.  All three movies were wonderful.  Talk about a Win - Win situation.  I was delighted.
Title: Holiday Triple Feature One Special Night / Christmas Clause / Christmas in the Clouds

reviewText: Interesting stories..... good for relaxing in front of a roaring fire and glass of wine... great watching on a quiet afternoon
Title: Holiday Triple Feature One Special Night / Christmas Clause / Christmas in the Clouds

reviewText: I liked One special night...this is a great great movie...James Garner and Julie Andrews are a hoot but it is also a beautiful, beautiful story!  It had a nice surprise ending...I will enjoy this movie for years to come!the movie Christmas clause was very predictable...wouldn't buy again or probably won't watch again...Christmas Clouds was a cute movie...funny and just had some nice warm fuzzies in it!
Title: Holiday Triple Feature One Special Night / Christmas Clause / Christmas in the Clouds

reviewText: Love the warm and happy moments in these films that makes Christmas so wonderful for families and friends.  It puts everyone in a spirit of love and joy.  Need more films like these!
Title: Holiday Triple Feature One Special Night / Christmas Clause / Christmas in the Clouds

reviewText: I enjoyed One Special Night. The others were a bit cheesy. But I could sit and watch CHRISTmas movies all day long so you have to take a few bad with the good.
Title: Holiday Triple Feature One Special Night / Christmas Clause / Christmas in the Clouds

reviewText: One Special Night is one of my favorite holiday movies ever.  I am putty in the hands of Julie Andrews and James Garner.  If you are interested in seeing this movie, I strongly suggest you purchase it on its own.  If you want to know more about it, there are ample 5-star reviews on Amazon.The other two movies - not so much.  I got maybe 10 minutes into Christmas Clause and turned it off.  A movie with vomiting in it just does not feel very festive, and by that point I was not nearly engaged enough to care what happened to Lea Thompson's character, much as I like that actress.I lasted a little longer with Christmas in the Clouds, but only because I was appalled by how awful it was.  Loaded with racial and ethnic stereotypes, mistakenly billed as a "riotous comedy," I was truly embarrassed for the poor actors who thought it was a good idea to appear in this misbegotten holiday-themed venture.I would give One Special Night 5 stars - even more if I could - but it is cheapened by combination with the other two movies.  This set is an example of the very best and very worst holiday fare produced for TV.
summary: One out of 3 is a 5-star movie
Title: Holiday Triple Feature One Special Night / Christmas Clause / Christmas in the Clouds
